TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Operation extends System.Web.Services.Description.NamedItem

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract definition of an action supported by the XML Web service. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> class corresponds to the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) `operation` element enclosed by the `portType` element. For more information about WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples The following example demonstrates a typical use of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> class. The example takes a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> that does not have a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.PortType> that supports the HTTP POST protocol. It adds a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.PortType> instance that supports POST, and writes out a new WSDL contract.
[!code-cpp[Operation_5#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_5/CPP/operation_5.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Operation_5#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_5/CS/operation_5.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Operation_5#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_5/VB/operation_5.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of instances of the class defined by the current .
Docs.value: The collection of instances of the class defined by the current .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because an <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> is associated with exactly one <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationInput> and exactly one <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationOutput>, only one instance of each can be a member of this collection, and thus the collection can have a maximum of two members.
## Examples [!code-cpp[Operation_5#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_5/CPP/operation_5.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[Operation_5#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_5/CS/operation_5.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Operation_5#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_5/VB/operation_5.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of the elements contained in the .
Docs.value: An array of names of instances.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The elements of this array are identical to those of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.ParameterOrderString%2A> property, but housed in an array rather than a space-delimited string.
## Examples [!code-cpp[Operation_2#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_2/CPP/operation_2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Operation_2#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_2/CS/operation_2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Operation_2#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_2/VB/operation_2.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an optional Remote Procedure Call (RPC) signature that orders specification for request-response or solicit-response operations.
Docs.value: A list of names of the instances separated by a single space.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The named <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> instances must adhere to the following rules:
- The order of the named <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> instances reflects the order of the parameters in the RPC (remote procedure call) signature, which is the name of the operation, its input and output parameters, the results it returns and the exceptions it might be asked to handle.
- The return value is not present in the list.
- If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> name appears in both the input and output messages, it is an `in/out` parameter.
- If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> name appears only in the input message, it is an `in` parameter.
- If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> name appears only in the output message, it is an `out` parameter.
Note that this parameter list is not required, even if the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> is to be used with an RPC-style <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Binding>. Do not call <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.ParameterOrderString%2A> directly. This method is only used internally for XML serialization. To return the parameter list use <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.ParameterOrder%2A>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[Operation_2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_2/CPP/operation_2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Operation_2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_2/CS/operation_2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Operation_2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Operation_2/VB/operation_2.vb#1)]
